item.title: Disturbing The Last of Us 2 Bug Turns Dina Into a Human Backpack
item.description:
Highlights

  • A bizarre glitch in Last of Us 2 turns Dina into a human backpack, which is unsettling yet humorous.
  • The user discovers the glitch online with Dina's body distorted around Ellie, causing nightmare fuel.

A Last of Us 2 player online has discovered a bizarre glitch in the game, which turns Dina into a human backpack. While Dina is a close companion in The Last of Us 2 , this particular glitch brings her closer than many gamers will be comfortable with.

Since the release of The Last of Us 2 back in 2020, players have discovered plenty of strange glitches in the game. This is partly due to the game's massive popularity. With more players playing, naturally, more issues will be found. Luckily, it's rare that these glitches are truly game-breaking, so it's much easier to see the funny side of them. One hilarious Last of Us 2 glitch caused Abby to T-pose during an intense moment , which, while funny, certainly has the potential to break the game's immersion.

Related
The Last of Us Speedrunner Sets Impressive World Record in Grounded Difficulty

A dedicated fan of The Last of Us sets a new world record speedrunning the game when playing on its hardest difficulty, Grounded mode.

This particular glitch was discovered by user ryanjc_123 on Reddit, who shared it with the Last of Us 2 community online. It's a terrifying series of screenshots that displays Dina's body, completely distorted in a variety of different ways, wrapped around Ellie like a human backpack. It's equal parts disturbing and hilarious, with no indication about what is actually causing this Last of Us 2 glitch . According to ryanjc_123, they spent an entire hour playing with the glitch, and the images shown don't even cover the full range of strange poses that Dina did during this period.

Disturbing Last of Us 2 Dina Glitch

While Dina stays close by Ellie's side through much of the story of The Last of Us 2 , this kind of thing certainly wasn't Naughty Dog's intention. Other gamers in the thread were quick to point out that at this point in the story, Dina is pregnant, with one user claiming "Pregnancy affects women in different ways." Another user pointed out a detail about her unborn child, saying, "JJ in there just going through it man." The general sentiment in the thread was that the whole thing was just sheer nightmare fuel.

It has been almost four years since The Last of Us 2 , and gamers have waited patiently for any news on a sequel. The good news is that earlier this year, Naughty Dog teased an exciting update for The Last of Us 3 , hinting that a direction for the story has finally been decided. However, it remains to be seen when the game will actually be released, with the developer giving nothing away about how far along in development the title is. While gamers have already shown a lot of patience in waiting for a sequel, it seems a little more might be required yet.

item.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 Clip Highlights Odd NPC Urine Detail
item.description:
Highlights

  • Red Dead Redemption 2 players have discovered unexpected interactions, like setting NPC urine on fire, as one player showed.
  • Rockstar's attention to detail shines as players continue to find hidden gems in the vast open-world game.
  • Pushing the boundaries of the game's simulation can lead to humorous incidents, keeping players entertained years after release.

A Red Dead Redemption 2 player has highlighted the deadly consequences of public peeing after showing off the unexpected flammability of urine in Rockstar's hit open-world cowboy game. The viral clip demonstrates the vastness of Red Dead Redemption 2 and some of the tidbits players are discovering and rediscovering years after release.

As one of the largest and most immersive open-world games around, Red Dead Redemption 2 continues to wow its players more than six years after its original release in 2018. Telling the story of Arthur Morgan and the Van der Linde gang at the end of America's wild west era, developer Rockstar put an almost excessive amount of detail into the game's simulation-like aspects, modeling interactions that no reasonable player could be expected to try out.

Related
Red Dead Redemption 3 Should Turn a Heavily Memed RDR2 Moment Into a Feature

Red Dead Redemption 2 incorporates one theme in a memorable way, and the third game should go all in on the idea, making it a big new mechanic.

Oftentimes it's that very expectation of "reasonable" player behavior that reveals unexpected interactions, as when players push against the boundaries of the game's simulation, they discover funny incidents. These range from funny bugs like glitched corpses witnessing the crimes of Arthur Morgan from beyond the grave to customized, self-imposed "hardcore" rule sets that deliberately eschew many of the game's convenience features to make for a more challenging time in the old west. Red Dead Redemption 2 player cvvitor shared a pair of clips with the game's Reddit community that demonstrate the unusually volatile nature of the urine expelled by NPCs when they pee in public.

Red Dead Redemption 2 Player Sets NPC Urine Alight in New Clip

Their clips show a rather common sight seen in the game's various towns: a local or traveler relieving themselves against a wall outside a saloon. Cvvitor turns their pistol upon the small puddle of pee pooling near the NPC's legs and shoots it, only to find that the stream lights up like the fire that consumed the home of Sadie Adler in the prologue mission. The flame climbs up the NPC's foot, causing them to flail haplessly and eventually die.

Commenters on cvvitor's post were amused by the unexpected ignition, joking that Rockstar must either hate public urination enough to punish NPCs with "hellfire," or that the level of alcohol consumption in the game must be so high as to render their urine fully flammable. Some more sober-minded observers suggested that Rockstar had mistakenly programmed NPC urination using the same interactions that governed pouring gasoline or other truly flammable fluids out of jars or bottles, a mechanic used in some of the best Red Dead Redemption 2 missions . It's just that a "reasonable" player wouldn't be expected to shoot at a complete stranger's pee puddle, making it easy to forget that the pee is being treated the same as oil. Whether a bug or oversight, the discovery amused players enough that many commented with calls for Rockstar not to fix it, preserving the funny interaction for others to find in the future.

item.title: Animal Crossing: New Horizons Player Finds Bizarre Way to Pitfall Themselves
item.description:
Highlights

  • Players can use pitfalls in Animal Crossing: New Horizons to create hilarious moments for themselves and others.
  • A unique way to use pitfalls involves pole vaulting across a river and falling into strategically placed holes.

An Animal Crossing: New Horizons player has found a bizarre way to pitfall themselves after crossing a river. Pitfalls have been used in the series since the beginning, but this Animal Crossing: New Horizons clip highlights a unique possibility.

Since the first Animal Crossing game on the GameCube, players could dig holes and leave Pitfall Seeds behind for unsuspecting Villagers. Beyond messing with the inhabitants of a village, players could also use these on each other to inspire surprised reactions. This is a theme that has been maintained across every title in the series, with Pitfalls resulting in some hilarious Animal Crossing: New Horizons moments. Sometimes players dig up holes that they intend to return to with fruit or items in the future. One gamer stumbled on a unique way to use these holes against any visitors who may not be aware of a key possibility.

Related
Animal Crossing: New Horizons Fan Recreates Iconic Dress Debate In-Game

A creative Animal Crossing: New Horizons fan recreates a hilariously notorious dress meme, once again sparking debate among audiences.

Reddit user Olive-pearl recently shared a clip that highlights their custom Animal Crossing: New Horizons Villager pole vaulting into a hole. The clip begins with the player holding a Vaulting Pole between a river and a cherry blossom tree. They then aim at four holes across the river and press the A button to vault across the body of water. As their character reaches the ground, they plummet into the nearest hole, resulting in the scrambling Pitfall Seed animation. Despite the hole being empty upon contact, the Villager spends a moment floating above it as if they had stepped on an area marked by a Pitfall Seed. They then thrash around for a few seconds before flipping out of the hole and standing on the newly formed ground.

Can Other Villagers Fall Into These Holes?

Although this animation has always been possible, it's rare for players to stumble across it by pole vaulting across a river. The animation of the Villager plummeting into the hole seems tied to the Animal Crossing: New Horizons Pitfall Seed . This is evidenced by the character floating in place before falling, and the button-mash mini-game required to escape the hole. Because other Villagers may not fall into these holes in the absence of a Vaulting Pole, the tool may be used in the same way by an unwitting visitor. This same issue may be spotted by players who climb down cliffs next to a hole or gamers who hop across narrow passages that have holes at the other end.

While this hole mishap has been possible since New Horizons was released, some players still haven't encountered it. As Nintendo rarely updates Animal Crossing: New Horizons anymore, this animation may not be adjusted before the game's successor releases.

item.title: Stardew Valley Fan Creates Beautiful Cross-Stitch Embroidery
item.description:
Highlights

  • Many Stardew Valley fans showcase their love through creative crafts like cross-stitched embroidery, capturing the game's essence.
  • Community-made creations like quilts, portraits, and baked goods highlight a special bond among fans of the indie hit.
  • Updates in Stardew Valley spark inspiration for new fan creations, from NPC outfits to real-world dishes based on in-game meals.

Fans of Stardew Valley frequently share real world crafts inspired by the game, including one player who cross-stitched a beautiful embroidery featuring the game's title screen. Stardew Valley fan creations are often used to showcase players' love of the farming sim, with many fans finding unique new ways to highlight familiar yet underappreciated elements of the indie title.

Since its initial release back in 2016, Stardew Valley has become one of the most popular and successful indie games of all time. The iconic pixel adventure is considered by many to be one of the best life-sim games of all time, with many praising its wholesome storytelling, addictive gameplay, and adorable aesthetic. Many players have voiced their love of the game in online community spaces, and some fans have even used real world skills to bring the game to life.

Related
Stardew Valley Fan Creates Adorable Junimo Cross-Stitch

A Stardew Valley fan picks up cross-stitching as a new hobby and decides to make an adorable Junimo as one of their first creations.

Stardew Valley fan Books_and_Baking30 shared a snapshot of the gorgeous cross-stitch embroidery they made, capturing the iconic title screen of the game, along with an adorable heart icon in a chat bubble. The embroidery features the familiar sprawling mountains and fluffy white clouds that players see each time they load up the game, all set beneath a starry sky. In the foreground of the view are large, leafy trees, whose branches reach up towards the heart bubble that fans will recognize from nurturing pets and achieving NPC heart events in Stardew Valley . Fellow players complimented the beautiful creation, which highlights an unsung portion of the game and includes a sweet reference to key interactions.

Stardew Valley Fan Creations Are A Favorite Among Fans

While official Stardew Valley merchandise has offered audiences a number of opportunities to enjoy the game in their day-to-day lives, fans consistently show a special appreciation for crafts made by fellow community members. Unique creations like handmade cross-stiches, colorful quilts, glass dioramas, character portraits, and tasty baked goods have been transformed into Stardew Valley showpieces for fans of the game. Some players have even managed to encounter local cafes and shops selling Stardew Valley -themed items, highlighting the popularity of the game beyond online spaces and spotlighting the dedication of its community.

With big changes made in Stardew Valley Update 1.6 , players have even more content to explore and replicate in exciting ways. Some fans have already begun sharing their crafts inspired by new seasonal NPC outfits and even real-world dishes based on in-game meals. As more players discover the expansive world of Stardew Valley , the community and its creations are likely to continue to grow.

item.title: Minecraft Fan Builds Incredible Elytra Racecourse
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Minecraft player's custom Elytra racecourse tests one's flying skills with rings and obstacles in an unique aerial challenge.
  • The Elytra item allows seasoned gamers to fly in Minecraft, acquired by beating the Ender Dragon.
  • Players can replicate the racecourse with cherry wood, dyed glass, and Firework Rockets.

A Minecraft player has built an incredible Elytra racecourse that goes from sea to sky. The Minecraft Elytra has long been a helpful tool for getting around any world, but this may be one of the most creative uses for it.

When Minecraft was released, players couldn't acquire Elytra, making getting around the world take much longer. Elytra was added to the game in the 1.9 update, which also included an overhaul to combat, an End revamp, and End Gateways. Since then, players can get the item by making their way to End cities on the outer islands of the End dimension. Once looted, the Elytra can be equipped to allow players to fly around their worlds using Firework Rockets as propulsion. As this requires beating the Minecraft Ender Dragon , the item is typically a tool used by the most seasoned veterans. One gamer has made a unique Elytra racecourse that makes further use of the traversal mechanic.

Related
Minecraft Player Builds a Walmart in the Game

A Minecraft player builds an incredibly accurate Walmart using the sandbox game's resources that has a huge parking lot full of vehicles.

Reddit user Inferno845 recently shared a clip of their Elytra racecourse that features rings players must fly through. These rings are spaced out across a narrow area of their world, making the racecourse a unique way to test Minecraft Elytra turning in midair. The video begins with the player flying through a pink ring that's quickly followed by a green ring between trees. They then fly upward to reach a ring near an ice bridge before entering the side of a mountain to acquire the next green ring. The gamer then climbs a waterfall to enter the next green ring, then weaves through three more. The racecourse then takes the player underwater for three rings before another airborne one. After passing through two more rings, the player reaches the starting point again, ending their run.

How Can Players Replicate This Minecraft Racecourse?

While Inferno845 passed through a set course of rings, players can take a different path to reach the same end. Some fans have suggested making the rings out of Minecraft Redstone with Tripwires so that gamers would have to do things in a set order. The Reddit user has denied this concept because they wish to preserve the green and pink aesthetic of the rings in the racecourse. According to the gamer, they share the server with some friends and intend to mark the order of the rings with Banners. For players to replicate this Elytra racecourse, they will need Cherry wood, Firework Rockets, lots of dyed glass, and clearings to place the rings in.

Although this racecourse was made for players with Elytra, Minecraft Creative allows any player to fly around. This base level of flying combined with the limitless resources in Creative may make a similar racecourse in the game mode more enticing. Inferno845 hasn't shared their Seed code with the community, making their video the only thing to go by if players wish to recreate the course.
